body_html:
@wt-huang Thank you for your reply. :)

I did follow the document from https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source. Specifically, I

  • got the source code via git checkout r1.11; git pull origin r1.11;
  • configured the build via ./configure; and
  • built via bazel build --config=opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package --verbose_failures but failed

Here is the content of tf_env.txt:

== cat /etc/issue ===============================================
Linux ****(removed for privacy) 4.15.0-34-generic #37~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Aug 28 10:44:06 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
VERSION="16.04.5 LTS (Xenial Xerus)"
VERSION_ID="16.04"
VERSION_CODENAME=xenial

== are we in docker =============================================
No

== compiler =====================================================
c++ (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.10) 5.4.0 20160609
Copyright (C) 2015 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.


== uname -a =====================================================
Linux ****(removed for privacy) 4.15.0-34-generic #37~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Aug 28 10:44:06 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

== check pips ===================================================
numpy                              1.14.3   
numpydoc                           0.8.0    

== check for virtualenv =========================================
False

== tensorflow import ============================================
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'

== env ==========================================================
LD_LIBRARY_PATH is unset
DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH is unset

== nvidia-smi ===================================================
Thu Oct  4 19:54:27 2018       
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 396.44                 Driver Version: 396.44                    |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name        Persistence-M| Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp  Perf  Pwr:Usage/Cap|         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
|   0  GeForce GTX 108...  Off  | 00000000:05:00.0  On |                  N/A |
| 45%   66C    P8    21W / 250W |    709MiB / 11175MiB |      0%      Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
|   1  GeForce GTX 108...  Off  | 00000000:06:00.0 Off |                  N/A |
| 81%   88C    P2   122W / 250W |   5443MiB / 11178MiB |     95%      Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
|   2  GeForce GTX 108...  Off  | 00000000:09:00.0 Off |                  N/A |
| 31%   51C    P8    19W / 250W |     12MiB / 11178MiB |      0%      Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
|   3  GeForce GTX 108...  Off  | 00000000:0A:00.0 Off |                  N/A |
| 24%   43C    P8    19W / 250W |     12MiB / 11178MiB |      0%      Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
                                                                               
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes:                                                       GPU Memory |
|  GPU       PID   Type   Process name                             Usage      |
|=============================================================================|
|    0      1330      G   /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg                            67MiB |
|    0     13190      G   /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg                            14MiB |
|    0     25789      C   python                                       511MiB |
|    1     25789      C   python                                      5431MiB |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+

== cuda libs  ===================================================

body:
@wt-huang Thank you for your reply. :) 

I did follow the document from `https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source`. Specifically, I
* got the source code via `git checkout r1.11; git pull origin r1.11`; 
* configured the build via `./configure`; and
* built via `bazel build --config=opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package --verbose_failures` but failed


Here is the content of `tf_env.txt`:

```
== cat /etc/issue ===============================================
Linux ****(removed for privacy) 4.15.0-34-generic #37~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Aug 28 10:44:06 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
VERSION="16.04.5 LTS (Xenial Xerus)"
VERSION_ID="16.04"
VERSION_CODENAME=xenial

No

warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
```
